thread.section_title: Artist of the day 21/03: Veridian – Metro
thread.title: Artist of the day 21/03: Veridian

author: achaldhillon
title: Artist of the day 21/03: Veridian
text:
(Photo: Veridian) Metro.co.uk and record label Killing Moon pick out the new artists you should listen to today. 
Louisa Johnson's new music video is basically a mini Coachella and we want an invite Veridian sound like : the monologue that runs in your head when you can’t sleep and you can’t really figure out why.
Similar artists : Young Guns, Lower Than Atlantis, You Me At Six, Malory Knox
Their story : Veridian are a six-piece rock band from Reading, Berkshire.
Forming just last year, the band have already achieved much in terms of critical acclaim, having picked up coverage with BBC, Upset, Rock Sound, Scuzz, Punktastic and Kerrang Radio to name a few. 
International recognition from Norwegian tastemaker outlet P3 has also occurred, and the band sold out shows in both Reading and London.
What’s so great about them ? The band are tipped to be the next in line to challenge the poll-positioners of the UK rock scene.
Rock press have at a rather early stage began comparisons to scene stalwarts Young Guns and Malory Knox.
Most-streamed track on Spotify : Refuse To Feel
Most-recent video :

What will they be doing in 2017 : The band look set to step their game up in both the release and live stakes.
Recent single Sleep A Little Better is taken from a forthcoming EP to be released in May.
Fun fact: The band name – Veridian – is after a hue of green (spelt Viridian). The forthcoming EP name is the name of the hue colour: #40826D.
More: Music Zayn Malik drops teaser for new single with PartyNextDoor and the internet went cray 
Wyclef Jean left handcuffed by LA police after being mistaken as suspect in armed robbery 
Drake's new album More Life smashed a ton of streaming records on its first day 
Signed to : Primordial Records
Upcoming live dates :
14 April – Silkfest, Basingstoke 3 June – Camden Rocks, London 8 July – HOPFEST, The Prince Of Wales, Kettering 23 July – Amplified Festival – Cheltenham
